nodes.bodyText: Why scoping to the session?
Removed in ff7ec15

Wouldn't a better URL scheme be top level /ajax/statistics and then every level below would be the specific one (e.g. /projects for /ajax/statistics/projects)?
``
Yup updated in ff7ec15
This translation will be in the next PR?
The translations will be added once all the branches are merged in for the statistics
Just pondering.  Wouldn't it be better to get the message (error.response.data) and then throw that in a new Error so it can be caught by the caller?
I was going to deal with the error stuff in another branch but its been updated here ff7ec15
I don't think this actually works does it?  You are returning the error which I think at this point is the response, not the message.  See my previous comment on throwing a new error.
Updated in ff7ec15
Formatting!  Why would you do this!!!!
I totally missed that. Probably "accidentally" hit the ENTER key :)
Fixed in ff7ec15
Don't leave XML entries with empty bodies in React
Updated in ff7ec15
Updated in ff7ec15. Learned something new in the process :)
This is already "truthy".  If you want to force it you could also do `visible: Boolean(data)`
Updated in ff7ec15
This could be simplified as: `data: data || [{key:"", value:""}],`
Updated in ff7ec15
I also do not think this needs to be in the context.  It could be in a separate file and just called.  I don't think there is anything in here that is directly needed from the context.
Updated and moved into a new file in ff7ec15
Take a look at Row and Col from Ant Design.  You get a lot of this with proper height separations and media queries. Right now your cards stack on touching each other
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,103 @@
+/*
+ * This file renders the Basic Statistics component
+ * with functionality to view advanced statistics
+ * charts
+ */
+
+import React, { useContext, useState } from "react";
+import { Button, Card, Statistic } from "antd";
+import { SPACE_LG, SPACE_XS } from "../../../../styles/spacing";
+import AdvancedStatistics from "./AdvancedStatistics";
+import {
+  AdminStatisticsContext,
+  defaultTimePeriod,
+  statisticTypes,
+  timePeriodMap
+} from "../../../../contexts/AdminStatisticsContext";
+
+export default function BasicStats() {
+  const [statsChartView, setStatsChartView] = useState(null);
+
+  const { adminStatisticsContext } = useContext(
+    AdminStatisticsContext
+  );
+
+  return (
+    <div className="t-statistics">
+      <div style={{marginBottom: SPACE_LG}} className="t-stats-basic">
+        <div style={{display: "flex",
+          justifyContent: "flex-start", flexWrap: "wrap"}}>
+            <Card style={{width: 240, marginRight: SPACE_XS}}>

nodes.bodyText: I ended up adding marginBottom to the cards. The Row/Col broke the display and the buttons would overlap

nodes.bodyText: Maybe move these out into a constants file.
Moved in 567cdb7
Move this logic into the context.  pass it the type and the time period.  Keep the logic out of your component
Updated in 567cdb7

Just an FYI: this can also be written:
<TimePeriodSelect onChange={updateTimePeriod} />

Since you are just passing the argument.
Updated in 567cdb7
Can you rename this file to statistics-context.js  you have it named like a jsx component.
Take a look at https://kentcdodds.com/blog/how-to-use-react-context-effectively I find it a highly effective way of setting up contexts.
Renamed in 567cdb7

Is this just placeholder stuff? Why are you not just passing the data in directly?  I really thought all you would pass in here is the chartType.  If there is no data then you would not display any of this anyways.
Updated to pass data from the component directly in 567cdb7
You might want a separate config setup for just tiny charts
Added in 567cdb7
Is this still needed after the way I refactored it?
